steps.title: Verify that you’re using the word “welcome” as a greeting.
steps.content: Verify that you’re using the word “welcome” as a greeting. For example, you might say “Welcome!” when someone arrives at your home.

steps.title: Say “Bienvenido” when using “welcome” as a greeting.
steps.content: Say “Bienvenido” when using “welcome” as a greeting. “Bienvenido” is pronounced “bee-en-veh-nee-doh.” [1] X Research source When greeting a woman, say “bienvenida,” which is the feminine translation of “welcome.” “Bienvenida” is pronounced “bee-en-veh-nee-dah.”

steps.title: Verify that you’re using the word “welcome” as a noun in a sentence.
steps.content: Verify that you’re using the word “welcome” as a noun in a sentence. An example of using “welcome” as a noun is, “The woman is offering a warm welcome to her long-lost brother.”

steps.title: Say “bienvenida” when using “welcome” as a noun.
steps.content: Say “bienvenida” when using “welcome” as a noun. “Bienvenida” is the literal translation of “welcome” in Spanish. “Bienvenida” is pronounced “bee-en-veh-nee-dah.” [2] X Research source Alternately, you can say “recibimiento” or “acogida,” which are synonyms for “welcome” as a noun in Spanish. “Recibimiento” is pronounced “reh-see-bee-mee-en-toh,” and “acogida” is pronounced “ah-koh-hee-dah.”

steps.title: Verify that you’re using the word “welcome” as a transitive verb.
steps.content: Verify that you’re using the word “welcome” as a transitive verb. An example of using “welcome” as a transitive verb is, “The man is happy to welcome you to his home.”

steps.title: Say “dar la bienvenida a,” which means “to welcome.
steps.content: Say “dar la bienvenida a,” which means “to welcome. ” This phrase is pronounced as “dahr lah bee-en-veh-nee-dah ah.” [3] X Research source

steps.title: Verify that you’re using the word “welcome” as an adjective in a sentence.
steps.content: Verify that you’re using the word “welcome” as an adjective in a sentence. An example of using ”welcome” as an adjective is, “The new flowers will offer a welcome change to my yard.”

steps.title: Say “bienvenido,” which means “welcome” when using this word as an adjective.
steps.content: Say “bienvenido,” which means “welcome” when using this word as an adjective. “Bienvenido” is pronounced “bee-en-veh-nee-doh.” [4] X Research source
